intro: Galium texanum, commonly known as Texas bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a low-growing herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas. Galium texanum is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants.
